titlestmt.titleproper: Finding Aid for the Randall Stewart Papers

publicationstmt.publisher: Special Collections Manuscripts and Rare Books

repository.corpname: Special Collections Manuscripts and Rare Books

chronitem.event: His family moved to Nashville where he grew up and was educated
Was graduated from Vanderbilt University as Founder’s Medalist
Instructor of English at the University of Oklahoma
Served briefly in the armed forces
Married Cleone Odell in Oklahoma City
Awarded master of arts degree by Harvard University
Awarded doctor of philosophy degree by Yale
Chairman, American Literature Group, Modern Language Association
Professor of English and Chairman, Department of English, Vanderbilt University
Mrs. Harold S. Vanderbilt Literary Symposium established

did.unittitle: to Jesse Wills with enclosures of two letters dated Oct. 25, 1955
form letter to Fugitives and inter-locutor critics
form letter to Ransom, Davidson, Tate, Warren, Moore, Elliott, Brooks, Lytle
Memorandum to Ransom, Davidson, Tate, Warren, Elliott, Wills, Stevenson, Curry, Hirsch, Starr
Mr. and Mrs. Harold S. Vanderbilt
Louis Rubin. 2 copies, one with Rubin’s answer
Dr. O. C. Carmichael. Enclosure of 2 copies of letter from Donald Davidson to A. F. Kuhlman dated May 11, 1956
Participants in the Fugitive Conference. F 14. With replies from Fugitives. 2 copies
Holograph draft of letter to editors

did.unitdate: May 11, 1956 to Dr. A. F. Kuhlman. 2 copies
March 29, 1956 to Ransom, Tate, and Warren
March 30, 1956 to Barbara Cohen and Marianne
Aug. 29, 1959 to Henry C. Alexander and Benjamin Tate, 2 copies
Dec. 4, 1967, to Mrs. Stewart. Possibly George Core

did.unittitle: Calendars of Events and Guest List, Fugitive Reunion
